term.title: polymorphic transition

item.text: A reversible transition of a solid crystalline phase at a certain temperature and pressure (the inversion point) to another phase of the same chemical composition with a different crystal structure. Examples: The transitions of SiO2 (quartz-type) at 1143 K to SiO2 (tridymite-type), and at 1743 K to SiO2 (cristobalite-type). The transition of β-AgI (wurtzite-type structure) to α-AgI (body-centred-cubic structure) at 418 K. Synonymous with enantiotropic transition.

notes.item: In a liquid-crystal transition, this term refers to phase changes in the smectic state (in phase transitions) or columnar discotic state.

sources.item: PAC, 1994, 66, 577. 'Definitions of terms relating to phase transitions of the solid state (IUPAC Recommendations 1994)' on page 588 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199466030577)
